alert.note: Alert for Sioux (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 4:58AM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST/11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM CST /2 PM MST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory Wednesday and Thursday, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Sioux County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon CST/11 AM MST/ Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM CST /2 PM MST/ this afternoon to Noon CST /11 AM MST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel due to snow and blowing snow reducing visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing.
